org.epics.ioc.support.pdrv
Class AbstractPDRVSupport

java.lang.Object
  org.epics.ioc.support.AbstractSupport
      org.epics.ioc.support.pdrv.AbstractPDRVSupport
All Implemented Interfaces:
QueueRequestCallback, PDRVSupport, ProcessContinueRequester, RecordProcessRequester, Support, org.epics.pvData.pv.Requester
public abstract class AbstractPDRVSupport
extends AbstractSupport
implements ProcessContinueRequester, QueueRequestCallback, PDRVSupport, RecordProcessRequester

Abstract link support base class for PDRV links. It handles all the generic things for a PDRV link. It connects locates the interfaces for all the PDRV fields in the link structure. For each of the lifetime methods it provides methods (initBase, startBase, stopBase, uninitBase) than must be called by derived classes. The process and message implementation should be sufficient for most derived support.

Author:
mrk

public void callback(Status status,
                     User user)
Description copied from interface: QueueRequestCallback
The queueRequest has been dequeued.

Specified by:
callback in interface QueueRequestCallback
Parameters:
status - Status of the request. The request will fail if the port is not connected or if it is disabled. If the status is not Status.success than the user must NOT call and interfaces for the port and user.getMessage provides the reason.
user - The user.

isProcess

public boolean isProcess()
Description copied from interface: PDRVSupport
If the support is interrupt driver should it process the record. The answer will be true only if:
  1. The constructor for AbstractPDRVSupport is called with interruptOK true
  2. pdrvLink.interrupt is true.
  3. The support is the record processor.

Specified by:
isProcess in interface PDRVSupport
Returns:
(false,true) if the record should be processed.

queueCallback

public void queueCallback()
Description copied from interface: PDRVSupport
A method that must be implemented by all asynchronous support. This probably means all support except interrupt listeners.

Specified by:
queueCallback in interface PDRVSupport

recordProcessResult

public void recordProcessResult(RequestResult requestResult)
Description copied from interface: RecordProcessRequester
The result of the process request. This is called with the record still active and locked. The requester can read data from the record.

Specified by:
recordProcessResult in interface RecordProcessRequester
Parameters:
requestResult - The result of the process request.
